name: Project Lombok
description: Makes Java a spicier language by adding 'handlers' that know how to build and compile simple, boilerplate-free, not-quite-java code.

Features.val: How I learned to stop worrying and love the NullPointerException.
Automatic resource management: Call your close() methods safely with no hassle.
Never write public int getFoo() {return foo;} again.
No need to start a debugger to see your fields
Equality made easy: Generates hashCode and equals implementations from the fields of your object.
Generates constructors that take no arguments, one argument per final / non-null field, or one argument for every field.
A shortcut for @ToString, @EqualsAndHashCode, @Getter on all fields, and @Setter on all non-final fields, and @RequiredArgsConstructor!
No-hassle fancy-pants APIs for object creation!
To boldly throw checked exceptions where no one has thrown them before!
Synchronized done right: Don't expose your locks.
Captain's Log, stardate 24435.7: What was that line again?
